adjective.description: Belonging to the genus Homarus (family Nephropidae) of large-clawed lobsters; resembling or having the characteristics of such a lobster. Now rare.

noun.description: A crustacean belonging to the genus Homarus; a large-clawed lobster. rare.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Thomas Huxley (1825–1895), biologist and science educationist. From scientific Latin Homarus, genus name + -ine.
